Sifttter Redux Update: New Markdown Support

Apr 21, 2014
1 minute read

The original Sifttter allows only for bulleted list items. Tonight, I pushed an update to Sifttter Redux that allows for any level of Markdown to exist in a journal entry.

Open on Github

Whereas Sifttter focuses on entries that look like this:

- April 21, 2014 at 8:33 PM - My entry goes here@done

…Sifttter Redux now looks for entries that look like this:

@begin
@date April 21, 2014 at 8:34 PM
**Any** type of *Markdown* can exist _here_.
@end

This allows your Sifttter data to contain more complex entries, such as tables, images, or anything else that you might direct IFTTT to produce.

To update your installation:

$ gem update sifttter-redux

Finally, Sifttter Redux also includes a command that attempts to update your Sifttter files to the new format:

$ srd upgrade

Please make sure you back up your Sifttter files before running this command; although it, too, makes a backup, I don’t want your data to accidentally be hurt.

Let me know if you have any questions!
